key_mistakes.reason: Black doesn't contest the center with 2...e5, allowing White better control.
White misses an opportunity to control the center more effectively.
Retreating the bishop instead of developing with initiative.
Blocks the f-pawn and misses better piece coordination.
Misplaced bishop, allowing White more freedom.
Misses a chance to put pressure on Black's position.
King safety is compromised; better was to solidify the position.
Blunder that severely weakens White's position.
Blunder that allows Black to gain a decisive advantage.
Blunder that misses a defensive opportunity.
Blunder that weakens the pawn structure unnecessarily.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center early in the game.
Coordinate your pieces to work together effectively.
Avoid unnecessary pawn moves that create weaknesses.
